data.title: Poverty and Median Income Estimates for Texas Counties
data.meta_description: Poverty and Median Income Estimates for Texas Counties - Texas Cancer Information provides you an easy way to see poverty and median income estimates for Texas, the United States and all Texas counties.
data.text:
To help Texans better understand issues surrounding access to health care services, Texas Cancer Information is now providing easy access to United States, Texas, and Texas county-level poverty and median income estimates.

The poverty and median income estimates are from the U.S. Census Bureau, Small Area Estimates Branch, release date December 2008 for 2006 and 2007 data and November 2009 for 2008 data. The U.S. Census Bureau's Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates (SAIPE) program produces annual estimates of income and poverty statistics for all states, counties, and school districts. The main objective of the SAIPE program is to provide estimates of income and poverty for the administration of federal programs and the allocation of federal funds to local jurisdictions.

The SAIPE program produces the following state and county estimates:

total number of people in poverty

number of children under age 5 in poverty (for states only)

number of related children ages 5 to 17 in families in poverty

number of children under age 18 in poverty

median household income

The estimates are not direct counts from enumerations or administrative records and they are not direct estimates from sample surveys. The SAIPE program models income and poverty estimates by combining survey data with population estimates and administrative records. Please refer to the U.S. Census Bureau SAIPE Methodology page at http://www.census.gov/did/www/saipe/methods/index.html for more details and for General Cautions About Comparisons of Estimates.

Poverty and Median Income Estimates Search Criteria
